feed.title: Rafal Kucharski Lab
feed.subtitle: Urban Mobility Lab at Jagiellonian University, Poland: Where transport engineering meets network science and machine learning.

entry.title: GMUM workshops 2025
entry.content: Another edition of the workshops organized by GMUM (Group of Machine Learning Research) is behind us, bringing with it many inspiring discussions on the applications of artificial intelligence, new ideas, and connections made. We look forward to continued collaboration and promising research!
entry.summary: Rafal Kucharski's LAB took part in GMUM workshops

entry.content: This Wednesday Rafal will present overview of our findings at the Kongres Mobilno≈õci 2025 Conference in Krak√≥w, he will talk about possible future of traffic jams with Autonomous Vehicles. More info and slides here

entry.title: San Diego! Here we come!
entry.content:
Exciting news! üéâOur work URB ‚Äì Urban Routing Benchmark for RL-equipped Connected Autonomous Vehicles has been accepted to the prestigious NeurIPS 2025 conference!

We‚Äôre thrilled to share our research with the global AI community ‚Äî and even more excited to be heading to San Diego this year. San Diego, here we come!
entry.summary: Rafal Kucharski Lab will present at NeurIPS 2025

entry.title: SUM project General Assembly
entry.content: Last week Hanna participated in the SUM project General Assembly in Fredrikstad. The two days were marked by discussions on the progress of the project and provided a platform for the mutual exchange of experiences. We also reviewed the achievements to date within Living Labs and among our partners. Additionally, we set the priorities for the third year of the project ‚Äì all with the aim of delivering tangible benefits to cities across Europe üåÜüí™ Many thanks to the organizers for the excellent organization!
entry.summary: Hanna Vasiutina participated in SUM project General Assembly

entry.title: Onur at EWRL2025
entry.content: Members of our Lab are keeping busy during the conference season. Today, Onur is presenting his work titled ‚ÄúRouting Autonomous Vehicles Using RL ‚Äì Progress and Future Directions‚Äù at the 18th European Workshop on Reinforcement Learning (EWRL 2025) in T√ºbingen. This is another edition with our participation, and therefore another opportunity for broad discussion on open problems and future research directions within the European reinforcement learning research community.
entry.summary: Onur Akman from Rafal Kucharski presenting at EWRL2025

entry.title: Grzegorz at DTA2025üßë‚Äçüè´
entry.content: Today, during the 10th International Symposium on Dynamic Traffic Assignment (DTA2025) in Salerno Grzegorz, on behalf of Gunnar Fl√∂tter√∂d, Rafa≈Ç Kucharski and David Watling, is presenting the work Coexistence of human drivers and CAVs - behavioral models and long-term properties. DTA is dedicated to the latest research and methods for modeling dynamic traffic assignment, which help better understand and predict road users‚Äô behavior in real time. This year‚Äôs edition offers a valuable opportunity for Grzegorz to share insights on cutting-edge optimization, simulation, and analysis methods for transportation systems aimed at enhancing efficient traffic management.
entry.summary: Grzegorz Jamroz from Rafal Kucharski Lab is presenting at DTA as a part of COeXISTENCE project

entry.title: Presenting our research in lovely Edinburgh at EWGT2025 annual conference

link.title: Presenting our research in lovely Edinburgh at EWGT2025 annual conference

entry.content: During Euro Working Group on Transportation 2025 27th Annual Conference Olha is presenting our research on how to strategically select areas for feeder service to maximise a shift from private cars to public transport. These results are a part of SUM Project. Such a great opportunity to get feedback and exchange experiences.
entry.summary: Olha Shulika is presenting at EWGT2025 as a part of SUM project

entry.title: We don‚Äôt slow down even during the holidaysüèÉ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

link.title: We don‚Äôt slow down even during the holidaysüèÉ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

entry.content: Last two weeks of July were very busy time for Anastasia who attended the DLRL Summer School 2025 in Edmonton, Canada. It allowed to expand her knowledge on reinforcement learning. A highlight was the keynote by Richard Sutton. She also worked with Lucas Cruz on a project based on an idea she proposed, which they presented on the final day. We are glad we could support her visit!
entry.summary: Anastasia Psarou participated in the Deep Learning + Reinforcement Learning Summer School in Edmonton

entry.title: Our results accepted for publication in SoftwareX!üí£

link.title: Our results accepted for publication in SoftwareX!üí£

entry.content: We‚Äôre thrilled to announce that the team‚Äôs latest publication has been accepted for publication in the highly ranked journal SoftwareX. Congratulations to the entire team ‚Äî a truly well-deserved success! üëè You‚Äôll soon be able to read about RouteRL in open access. RouteRL is a new framework that combines multi-agent reinforcement learning with detailed traffic simulations to explore route choice strategies for autonomous vehicles. It models both human drivers and AVs, enabling research in transportation, MARL, and human-AI interaction. This study introduces the framework, its research potential, and illustrative use cases.
entry.summary: Rafa≈Ç Kucharski's Lab latest article is accepted for publication in SoftwareX journal. Discover RouteRL, a new framework that combines multi-agent reinforcement learning with detailed traffic simulations to explore route choice strategies for autonomous vehicles.

entry.title: CASPT2025 in Kyoto
entry.content:
Last week at the CASPT conference in Kyoto, Rafal presented SimFLEX ‚Äì a microsimulation tool for planning on-demand feeder bus services. It combines demographic, spatial, and transport data to compare urban areas and assess service efficiency. Applied in Krak√≥w‚Äôs Skotniki and Bronowice districts, SimFLEX revealed Skotniki as the more attractive site, while Bronowice showed greater potential for wait time reduction. Sensitivity analysis on alternative-specific constants confirmed Skotniki as the preferred deployment site. üîç A powerful tool for smarter urban mobility ‚Äì developed as part of the SUM Project.

See preprint here
entry.summary: Rafal Kucharski participated in CASPT2025 conference in Kyoto
